member.summary: Adapter that allows an implementation to be used as a bilingual content processor.

member.name: T:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.Core.Utilities.BilingualApi.CharacterCountingIterator
member.summary: Iterator that counts characters of text and tag items as it is moved forward and backward through the content of a paragraph.

remarks.para: Characters are counted in a similar fashion to how the content is represented in native API.
Moving over a text item increments the count according to the number of characters that are found in the text.
Moving over the start of a tag pair increments the count according to the number of characters in the tag content of the start tag properties.
Moving over the end of a tag pair increments the count according to the number of characters in the tag content of the end tag properties.
Moving over a placeholder tag increments the count according the number of characters in the tag content of the placeholder tag properties.
Moving over a locked content node increments the count according to the number of characters that are present in all tags and text in the locked content (recursively).
This component is used by the framework for approximate mapping of locations between the bilingual content and the native output format.

member.name: M:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.Core.Utilities.BilingualApi.CharacterCountingIterator.#ctor(Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.BilingualApi.Location)
member.summary: Create the iterator with a specified start location. The root parent of the location determines the scope of the iteration. The iterator will not count past the end of the top-level parent.
member.param: The location passed to the iterator will be used and modified by the iterator. If you do not want the location to change, pass in a clone.

member.summary: This constructor overload allows a custom implementations of the counter visitor implementations.

remarks.para: Use this constructor with factory methods to create your own versions of the and to customize the character counting algorithm.

param.name: startCounterFactory
param.para: Factory method to create the implementation of the visitor that is used to count characters at the start of container nodes.

param.name: endCounterFactory
param.para: Factory method to create the implementation of the visitor that is used to count characters at the end of container nodes.

member.name: M:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.Core.Utilities.BilingualApi.CharacterCountingIterator.MoveNext
member.summary: Increments the character count by the number of characters between the current location and the next location, and advances the location one step by calling .

member.name: M:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.Core.Utilities.BilingualApi.CharacterCountingIterator.MovePrevious
member.summary: Decrements the character count by the number of characters between the current location and the next location, and moves to the previous location by calling .

member.name: P:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.Core.Utilities.BilingualApi.CharacterCountingIterator.CharacterCount
member.summary: Number of characters counted up to this location.

remarks.para: If moving backwards of the start location, this may be a negative number.
Assign to this property to reset the counter.

member.name: P:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.Core.Utilities.BilingualApi.CharacterCountingIterator.CurrentLocation
member.summary: The current counting location

remarks.para: Assigning to this property has the effect of "jumping" to the new location without affecting the accumulated character count.

member.name: P:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.Core.Utilities.BilingualApi.CharacterCountingIterator.CharactersToNextLocation
member.summary: The number of characters that that appear between the current location and the next available location.

remarks.para: This property is 0 if no location is available after the current location.

member.name: P:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.Core.Utilities.BilingualApi.CharacterCountingIterator.CharactersToPreviousLocation
member.summary: The number of characters that appear between the current location and the preceding location.

remarks.para: This property returns 0 if no previous location exists.

member.name: T:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.Core.Utilities.BilingualApi.ProcessParagraphUnitHandler
member.summary: Handler for

summary.para: This component is a bilingual content processor that implements the interface by raising events before and after each corresponding call on the .
Event handlers can be used to provide selective processing of calls, before and after they are made on the output.
Handlers that modify the content should be connected to the Before... events. If content is changed in an After... event, the output may not be aware of those changes.
This provides a convenient way of adding pieces of bilingual processing functionality without having to define a full bilingual processor.

member.name: T:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.Core.Utilities.BilingualApi.ParagraphUnitBuffer
member.summary:
A buffer for instances
The buffer can be turned on and off. While turned on, it caches all paragraph units passed to it through calls on . When turned off, the paragraph units are output to the set as the property.
Call to make the buffer start buffering paragraph unit calls. Call to have all buffered paragraph units output to the content processor and stop buffering calls.
You can access and modify the content of the buffer through the property.

remarks.para: This class is used in the implementation of the Native to Bilingual Converter and other implementations in which buffering of bilingual content is necessary.

member.name: M:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.Core.Utilities.BilingualApi.ParagraphUnitBuffer.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor - creates a new empty buffer that is not holding.

member.name: M:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.Core.Utilities.BilingualApi.ParagraphUnitBuffer.#ctor(Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.BilingualApi.IBilingualContentHandler)
member.summary: Construct with the bilingual content processor that will be used for output from the buffer.

member.name: M:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.Core.Utilities.BilingualApi.ParagraphUnitBuffer.Hold
member.summary: Start buffering ParagraphUnits. If the buffer is already holding, this call has no effect.

member.name: M:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.Core.Utilities.BilingualApi.ParagraphUnitBuffer.Release
member.summary: Releases the buffer content by calling the appropriate Process method for each ParagraphUnit on the Output. Removes all ParagraphUnits from the buffer.

member.name: M:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.Core.Utilities.BilingualApi.ParagraphUnitBuffer.ProcessParagraphUnit(Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.BilingualApi.IParagraphUnit)
member.summary: Call this to process a ParagraphUnit. If the buffer is holding, the paragraph unit will be added to the buffer and output once the buffer has been released. If not, the paragraph unit will be output immediately.

member.summary: When the buffer is not holding calls, all ParagraphUnits will be output to this interface.

member.summary: Indicates if the buffer is actively buffering calls.

member.summary: true if the buffer is empty.

member.summary: Used by the to specify how existing content in a target segment should be processed.

member.summary: Causes existing target content to be fully replaced with a copy of the source content.

member.summary: ParagraphUnits with existing target content will be skipped, the target content remains unchanged.

member.name: F:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.Core.Utilities.BilingualApi.ExistingContentHandling.ThrowException
member.summary: Causes an exception to be thrown if any existing target content is encountered.

summary.para: Bilingual content processor that copies source content to the target for all localizable paragraph units.

Segments are handled specifically in this operation: if is true, any content inside the segments is removed, and the segment properties are set to "not translated". Otherwise, the segment content from the source is duplicated, and the segment translation origin is set to "copied from source".
The property (and the corresponding constructor parameter) determines how this processor handles situations in which content is already present in the target of the paragraph unit.

member.summary: For localizable paragraph units, copy the source content into the target. Any changed segments receive the status if they contain a copy of the source, or if they are copied as empty segments.

remarks.para: Set the property to specify how paragraph units with existing target content should be handled.

member.summary: Is used for code page detection. First, the file is searched for a BOM. If a BOM exists and points to UNICODE, the appropriate code page is returned with the level Certain. Otherwise, the encoding tools are used to return the code page with the level Likely.

A suggested codepage that may be used if it is a valid option.
String for the line break type.
member.returns: A Pair container that holds the detected codepage and the information on how likely it is to be the correct one.

A suggested codepage that may be used if it is a valid option.

member.name: T:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.Core.Utilities.Formatting.FormattingGroup
member.summary: Default implementation of the interface, i.e. a set of formatting properties that together represent a formatting override.

remarks.para: instances should normally be created using the , which is accessible from the . However, if the factory is for some reason not available, this class provides a useful default implementation that can be instantiated directly.
This is a dictionary of key/value pairs, which contains formatting names as keys and formatting items as values. Naturally, it is only possible to define a single value for each type of formatting.

Very often, formatting is used together with a , where different formatting is overlaid with each other. When formatting types conflict, values for the more significant layers override values for the same type in less significant layers.
You can use and to merge other formatting layers with this one.

member.name: T:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.Core.Utilities.Formatting.FormattingStack
member.summary: Holds a collection of formatting instances that are to be treated as layered on top of each other. The compiles the layers into a single formatting instance that represents the accumulated effect of all the layers.

remarks.para: This is implemented as a list rather than a stack to provide more flexibility in accessing the layers. The order of the items in the list determines their precedence. The most significant item comes first.

member.name: T:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.Core.Utilities.IntegrationApi.Framework1ExternalPreviewException
member.summary: This exception is thrown by the TTX filter framework 1 preview writer adapter (TtxPreviewNativeWriter) when a FF 1 filter has successfully generated an external preview, which it will manage itself (as opposed to the preview that is managed by a preview application or preview control).

remarks.para: Explicitly handling this exception allows a preview host application to be notified that the preview has been successfully generated, but should be treated as a "fire and forget" preview. The preview files typically are not the file names that are passed to the writer, and they will be automatically deleted when the external preview application is closed by the user.
Note that throwing an exception here is rather a hack, however for the moment no a better way of handling this situation is available.

member.name: T:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.Core.Utilities.NativeApi.Buffer.NativeBuffer
member.summary:
A buffer for calls to INativeExtractionContentHandler and INativeGenerationContentHandler
Set the property on the buffer to the correct derived type. Strongly typed properties and Both map to the same instance, and can be used equivocally.
Start buffering calls by calling , and stops buffering by calling . When Release is called, any calls that are in the buffer will be invoked on the , or .
If Release is called after EndOfInput is received and there is content left in the buffer, an exception is thrown, since the output should not be generated after EndOfInput. It is the buffer user's responsibility to ensure that the buffer is emptied before end of input is called for the parser components following it.

member.summary: Default constructor, creates an empty buffer where is false.

member.summary: Call this to start buffering calls.

member.name: M:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.Core.Utilities.NativeApi.Buffer.NativeBuffer.Release
member.summary: Releases the buffer content to the Output and turns off buffering.
member.exception: thrown, if there is content in the buffer, but EndOfInput has been called.

member.name: P:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.Core.Utilities.NativeApi.Buffer.NativeBuffer.IsEndOfInput
member.summary:
True, if EndOfInput has been reached. After that, Release() is no longer permitted if the buffer contains any content.
This property can be set to override this behaviour, but that is an advanced option that should only be exercised if no other option is available.

member.name: T:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.Core.Utilities.NativeApi.LineNumberTracker
member.summary: Native content processor implementation that tracks line and offset number for content passed through the native API.

remarks.para: This is intended to be used for components related to native text location message reporting, where line and offset numbers is the means of specifying a location for an error message.
Both line and offset numbers are 1-based, i.e. the first line in a file is line 1, and the first character on a line is character offset 1.

Line and offsets are calculated by looking at the text and tag properties passed through the content processor. Any text or tag content that contains a line break increments the current line number. The offset is reset to 1 after each line break and is incremented by 1 for each Unicode character after the line break.
Text and tags inside locked content are counted too.
The following is considered a line break character: a combination of CR+LF, a standalone LF, or a standalone CR. A CR+LF is counted as one single line break (CR = 0x0d, LF = 0x0a).
The current line and offset numbers can be read from the and properties. These properties can also be written to, which could be useful if the values need to be adjusted.

member.name: M:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.Core.Utilities.NativeApi.LineNumberTracker.GetCurrentLocation
member.summary: Returns a text location that corresponds to the current line and offset numbers.

member.summary: Gets the line and offset values as they were before the last increment.

member.name: M:Sdl.FileTypeSupport.Framework.Core.Utilities.NativeApi.LineNumberTracker.GetLocationAfterCurrentContent
member.summary: Gets the current line and offset values, i.e. after the last increment.

member.summary: If true, the last processed character was a CR (0x0d). This flag is used to determine whether an LF character (0x0a) should increment the line count or not, since CR + LF is counted as a single line break character.

summary.para: Indicates that length restrictions apply to the content.
This context type is also used for validation purposes.

remarks.para: The context metadata should contain the type of length information (e.g. chars, bytes) and the maximum and (optionally) minimum lengths as follows:

list.item: The metadata key MetaDataTypes.LengthType indicates the type of unit that the length limit is measured in. Normally, it is set to one of the values in LengthTypes.
The maximum length (if applicable) is set as the value of the metadata key MetaDataTypes.MaxValue.
The minimum length (if applicable) is set as the value of the metadata key MetaDataTypes.MinValue.
